name: Anthurium vittariifolium
description: Anthurium vittariifolium is an epiphytic aroid native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Colombia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features long, narrow, strap-like, dark green leaves (30-60 cm long) that hang down, resembling a ribbon or strap. The leaves have prominent white or silver veins. The plant displays an upright to pendulous growth habit and typically reaches 40-80 cm in height. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers typical of aroids. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique interest with its strap-like, hanging leaves. It's popular among aroid enthusiasts for its distinctive leaf form.
